citations.narrative:
The area housing the emu had a piece of metal siding that was bent and had some edges sticking out that emus could
contact. Also, the door into their shelter had some old bolts with flat rough edges that the emus could possibly touch.
These exposed edges could cause injury. Ensure that surfaces that emus can touch are free from sharp/rough edges.

On the outdoor area of the lemur's enclosure, there is an area of mesh about 10 inches long that was not secured to the
support post. The mesh did not have a gap in it yet; but over time it could get looser and then not contain the lemur.
Ensure that this area and all enclosure fencing for the lemur is secure.

A door in the shelter covered with wire mesh for the bobcats had some broken wires with points that the bobcats could
touch. Wire points could cause injury. Ensure that this area and and surfaces are maintained in a manner that prevents
injury.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class C license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) by 11/16/2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.150(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The area housing the emu had a piece of metal siding that was bent and had some edges sticking out that emus could 
contact. Also, the door into their shelter had some old bolts with flat rough edges that the emus could possibly touch. 
These exposed edges could cause injury. Ensure that surfaces that emus can touch are free from sharp/rough edges. 
3.80(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
On the outdoor area of the lemur's enclosure, there is an area of mesh about 10 inches long that was not secured to the 
support post. The mesh did not have a gap in it yet; but over time it could get looser and then not contain the lemur. 
Ensure that this area and all enclosure fencing for the lemur is secure. 
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
A door in the shelter covered with wire mesh for the bobcats had some broken wires with points that the bobcats could 
touch. Wire points could cause injury. Ensure that this area and and surfaces are maintained in a manner that prevents 
injury. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class C license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) by 11/16/2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and 
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
